title: Academic Management System - Lab 3
description: Java-based project developed for Programming Lab III. It features a RESTful API for managing subjects, professors, and students, including full CRUD operations, unit testing and UML diagrams to document the backend architecture.

title: Console-based Strategy Card Game in Java
description: Final project for Programming III. It's a two-player console card game built in Java, where each player competes using characters with distinct attributes. Features include combat logic, exception handling, random character generation, and UML design documentation.

title: Flask Movie API
description: Final project for Programming II at UTN. I built a REST API using Python and Flask to manage a local JSON database of movies. Features include CRUD operations, search engine, pagination, user ratings, and a frontend in HTML/CSS.

title: Web Portfolio Backend
description: Backend development for a personal portfolio as part of the Argentina Programa. Built with Java and Spring Boot, it includes RESTful endpoints for user authentication and managing personal information.

title: Animal Nursery Console System
description: Practical project for Programming III, developed in Java. It features a console application that simulates an animal nursery system. Includes class design for various animals and a main nursery class to manage them.

title: Web Portfolio Front-End
description: Development of a professional portfolio's user interface using Angular, HTML and CSS, as part of the Argentina Programa. It features components such as personal presentation, experience, education and integration with back-end via HTTP services.

title: Flexbox Dashboard - Final Project
description: Final project for Programming Lab II. A general dashboard layout designed using HTML and CSS with Flexbox. Includes side navigation, profile panel, featured content sections and a responsive layout for desktop.

title: Personal Portfolio in React
description: Web application built with React, Vite and Bootstrap, structured using Atomic Design principles. Features animations, visual effects, multi-language support (i18n), modular sections and is deployed on Vercel. A strong example of modern front-end development.

title: La Cuponera - FrontEnd
description: Team-built coupon management and discovery web platform. Features authentication, category browsing, interactive map of stores, dynamic filtering, vendor plans, multi-language support, and responsive design.

title: Superadmin Administration Panel
description: I developed a full-featured admin dashboard in React to manage users, subscriptions, maps, products, and company data. The interface features dynamic sidebar navigation, form validation, file uploads, and statistical charts to visualize key metrics. User experience and modular structure were top priorities.
